Package io.github.zero88.schedulerx.trigger.rule

Interface TriggerRule

public interface TriggerRule
Represents a rule that sets advanced conditions to allow the trigger to run or not.
Since:
2.0.0

  • Method Details

    • timeframes

      @NotNull @NotNull List<Timeframe> timeframes()
      Declares the timeframe that allows emitting a trigger
      Returns:
      list of timeframe
      See Also:
      • Timeframe

    • until

      Instant until()
      Declares the time that the trigger can run until to.
      Returns:
      the until time

    • leeway

      @NotNull @NotNull Duration leeway()
      Declares the allowable margin of time in the time validation of satisfy(Instant) and until().

      The leeway time has constraints:

      • when given argument is negative, the leeway time fallback to Duration.ZERO
      • when given argument is greater than DefaultOptions.triggerRuleMaxLeeway, the leeway time fallback to max default value
      Returns:
      the leeway time

    • satisfy

      default boolean satisfy(@NotNull @NotNull Instant firedAt)
      Check if the fired time is satisfied to at least one timeframe.
      Parameters:
      firedAt - a clock time that the system timer fires the trigger
      Returns:
      true if the trigger time is satisfied, otherwise is false
      See Also:
      • timeframes()

    • isExceeded

      default boolean isExceeded(@NotNull @NotNull Instant firedAt)
      Check if the fired time is exceeded the registered until() time.
      Parameters:
      firedAt - a clock time that the system timer fires the trigger
      Returns:
      true if the trigger time is exceeded, otherwise is false
